case_vignette: A 56-year-old female presents with an intensely itchy patch on her right upper back for the past three years with intermittent sensations of numbness and tingling. She denies any trauma to the area. She only applies topical over the counter hydrocortisone without any relief. She denies any history of eczema and only takes multivitamins on a daily basis. Examination of the right scapula reveals a poorly defined hyperpigmented ruddy brown ovoid patch without significant lichenification.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a really itchy spot on my upper back that's been bothering me for three years and sometimes it feels numb and tingly.
Have you noticed any changes in the appearance of the spot?
Yes, the spot has turned into a sort of brownish color that doesn't have a clear shape.
Have you noticed any pain or discomfort in the spot?
No, I haven't felt any pain, just itching and some numbness and tingling.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin anywhere else on your body?
No, I haven't noticed any changes on other parts of my body.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin after exposure to the sun or any other environmental factors?
I haven't noticed any changes related to sun exposure or environmental factors.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin after any recent injuries or trauma?
No, I haven't had any injuries or trauma to the area.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin after any recent changes in your diet or lifestyle?
No, there haven't been any changes in my diet or lifestyle recently.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin after any recent medications or treatments?
I've only used over-the-counter hydrocortisone cream on it, but it hasn't helped.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin after any recent travel to a new area or exposure to new environments?
No, there haven't been any changes related to travel or new environments.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin after any recent stress or emotional changes?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my skin related to stress or emotional changes.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin after any recent changes in your sleep patterns or sleep quality?
No, my sleep patterns and sleep quality haven't changed recently.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin after any recent changes in your exercise routine or physical activity level?
No, there haven't been any changes in my exercise routine or physical activity level that have affected my skin.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin after any recent changes in your work environment or job?
No, there haven't been any changes at work that have affected my skin.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin after any recent changes in your family history or medical history?
No, there haven't been any recent changes in my family or medical history that have affected my skin.
Final Diagnosis: Melanoma.
